profile_positions.description:
Metrology coordinator for the Process R&D center.
Team and project manager.
Expert in  analytical chemistry technologies for the assesment of trace molecules (eg. polyaromatic hydrocarbons, dioxins, NOx, SOx...) and major gas phase compounds ( eg. H2, CO2, CO, O2, CH4 ) involved in iron and steel processes .  

Optimization of production process parameters contributing to the  reduction CO2, environnemental emissions and energy consumption for ArcelorMittals's production sites worldwide.

Expertise in analytical techniques  for the characterization of  molecules using: 

- Mass spectrometry
- IR/Laser/ FTIR spectroscopy
-Specific technologies used on the quantification of hydrocarbons, H2, O2, CO, CO2, VOC, NOx, SOx, H2S,   and humidity. From traces (ppb level) to high % concentrations.
-  Gas flow and pressure measurements
- Soot and slurry characterizations.
profile_positions.title: Research Engineer - Expert in gas phase analysis and head of the Gas Analysis Laboratory

company.name: CNRS - Centre national de la recherche scientifique - LRGP - GeoRessources

profile_positions.description:
- Experimental and modeling study of Geological storage of H2S and CO2  in  depleted oil reservoirs. 
- Study of Sulfur-Hydrocarbons interactions in Oil Reservoir conditions focused in highly aromatized fractions (Asphaltenes and resins).  
- Understand  and propose organo-sulfur compounds ( mercaptans, thiophens, benzothiophens) formation and consumption pathways by  the interaction of alkylaromatic compounds with H2S.
- Understand of the side chain cracking and aromatization pathways of alkylaromatics ( n-butylbenzene) at high pressure (700 bar) and mild temperature conditions ( 310°C -350°C).
- Develop detailed free-radical kinetic models describing the aromatic compounds cracking in presence of H2S. 
- Improve of the filling devices and procedures to load hydrocarbons and hazardous gases (eg. H2S) into gold sealed micoreactors.
- Perform of high pressure (700 bar) confined pyrolysis experiments of pure n-butylbenzene, n-butylbenzene - H2S and n-octane - H2S mixtures.
-Develop and improve the experimental and analytical methods for the identification and quantification  of pyrolysis products (e.g Thermodesortion coupled to multidimentional gas chromatography with cryogenic focus).
- Perform thermal cracking simulations of aromatic and aliphatic compounds with and without H2S  under thermal-EOR conditions ( 200°C- 250°C) and natural hydrocarbon maturation (100°C -150°C).

company.name: ArcelorMittal
company.description:
ArcelorMittal is the world's leading steel and mining company, with a presence in more than 60 countries and an industrial footprint in 18 countries. Guided by a philosophy to produce safe, sustainable steel, we are the leading supplier of quality steel in the major global steel markets including automotive, construction, household appliances and packaging, with world-class research and development and outstanding distribution networks.

Through our core values of sustainability, quality and leadership, we operate responsibly with respect to the health, safety and wellbeing of our employees, contractors and the communities in which we operate.

For us, steel is the fabric of life, as it is at the heart of the modern world from railways to cars and washing machines. We are actively researching and producing steel-based technologies and solutions that make many of the products and components we use in our everyday lives more energy-efficient.

We are one of the world’s five largest producers of iron ore and metallurgical coal and our mining business is an essential part of our growth strategy. With a geographically diversified portfolio of iron ore and coal assets, we are strategically positioned to serve our network of steel plants and the external global market. 

In 2022, ArcelorMittal had revenues of $79.8 billion and crude steel production of 59.0 million metric tonnes, while iron ore production reached 45.3 million metric tonnes.
